commit_message:
Adds nova-idmapshift cli utility

nova-idmapshift will be used by the libvirt-lxc driver to
correctly shift ownership of instance rootfs for use with
user namespaces.

Partially implements: bp libvirt-lxc-user-namespaces

Change-Id: I9aee622cca4578149201f02d02231a7bd0cbe912
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/113545/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova-idmapshift = nova.cmd.idmapshift:main

commit_message:
Windows Server image creation

This patch prepends a guide for building Windows images for KVM OpenStack
to the guide and retains the previous notes at the bottom of the doc.

Change-Id: I029a428055dab59ec0a09b12933d38cd4d209bc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/95/116495/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>The first thing you will need is a computer capable of running KVM, with VT extensions enabled in the BIOS. It is advised to use a CentOS 6 machine as images created on newer distributions such as Ubuntu 14.04 or CentOS 7 will not boot on RHEL/CentOS 6 machines due to changes in the version of QCOW2 used. Creating the image on CentOS 6 means that the image you create will be bootable everywhere.</para> <para>Along with this you will need to have a Windows Server 2012 ISO accessible on the computer, appropriate product key and the <link xlink:href="http://alt.fedoraproject.org/pub/alt/virtio-win/latest/images/">Fedora signed VirtIO drivers</link>. Make sure you install virt-installer and virt-manager: <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>yum -y install virt-install virt-manager</userinput> </screen></para> <para>Alternatively, if you don't want to install the GUI virt-manager on to the computer, you can install that locally and connect to the computer over SSH with virt-manager.</para> <para>Make sure you have enabled IP forwarding in sysctl so that the VM will be able to access the networks when it comes online (if you want to copy scripts or other files onto it for example):<screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>echo 1 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward </userinput></screen></para> <para>Create a preallocated QCOW2 image in /tmp (I tried making a thin provisioned one and the Windows installer thought the disk size was zero) and set permissions so libvirt can access it: <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>cd /tmp</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>qemu-img create -f qcow2 -o preallocation=full ws2012.qcow2 15g</userinput><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>chmod o+wx ws2012.qcow2</userinput></screen> </para> <para>The 15GB number chosen above as the disk size is arbitrary, the actual install only takes up just under 7GB so if you want to keep the image as small as possible then something close to that would be optimal.</para> <para>Run virt-install to boot the VM with the WS2012 installer ISO and VirtIO driver ISO attached attached, the disk set as a VirtIO disk and NIC attached to the default created virbr0. Unfortunately the most recent "os-variant" available for MS Windows on the CentOS 6 version of virt-install is "win7" so that is what I chose here for better or worse:<screen> <prompt>#</prompt><userinput>virt-install --connect qemu:///system --arch=x86_64 -n ws2012 -r 2048 --vcpus=2 --disk path=/tmp/ws2012.qcow2,device=disk,bus=virtio,size=15 -c /mnt/Source/en_windows_server_2012_x64_dvd_915478.iso --vnc --noautoconsole --os-type windows --os-variant win7 --network=bridge:virbr0 --disk path=/mnt/Source/en_windows_server_2012_x64_dvd_915478.iso,device=cdrom,perms=ro -c /mnt/Source/virtio-win-0.1-81.iso</userinput></screen></para> <para>Once the virt-install command has started, you can view the GUI by either firing up virt-manager locally, remotely (and connect to the computer running virt-install via SSH) or simply connect directly to the VNC port running at 127.0.0.1:5900 (assuming no other KVM virtual machines are running on the same host).</para> <para>Complete the Windows Server 2012 installation as you normally would. We prefer the headless mode. During the installation Windows will complain that it can't find a disk to install to, and present a dialog to load drivers. The drivers should be in: <filename>D:\WIN8\AMD64</filename> and you are looking to install the VirtIO SCSI device driver (we will install the remaining VirtIO drivers after the operating system installation is complete and the virtual machine is running).</para> <para>Once the installation is completed, the machine will restart and you can set an administrator password and login. The first step after successful installation is to run a command prompt (if using headless mode one will be presented as soon as you login) and use pnputil to insert the remaining VirtIO drivers: <screen><userinput>pnputil -i -a D:\WIN8\AMD64\*.INF</userinput></screen></para> <para>We also want to enable .NET 2.0 and .NET 3.0/3.5 frameworks (E:\SOURCES\SXS is a directory on the WS2012 installer ISO): <screen><userinput>DISM /Online /Enable-Feature /FeatureName:NetFx3 /All /LimitAccess /Source:E:\SOURCES\SXS</userinput></screen></para> <para>At this point, we want to copy over the installer for the latest .NET 4.5, any patches, scripts, etc as well as <link xlink:href="https://github.com/cloudbase/cloudbase-init"> Cloudbase-Init</link> (we recommend the <link xlink:href="https://www.cloudbase.it/downloads/CloudbaseInitSetup_Beta_x64.msi">automated Jenkins gated build</link>) so we will create a directory for these files to go, map a CIFS network share, copy the files and then delete the share when we have completed the copy: <screen><userinput>net use x: \\FILESERVER01\</userinput><userinput>mkdir c:\source</userinput> <userinput>copy x:\OpenStack\setup\* c:\source\</userinput><userinput>net use x: /DELETE </userinput></screen> and then install Cloudbase-Init. If you are not familiar with this tool, it's a port of the popular <link xlink:href="https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CloudInit">Ubuntu Linux tool</link> that configures cloud virtual machines when they boot up based on a variety of configuration sources (we use ConfigDrive but also supported is the EC2 style metadata server, MaaS and others):<screen><userinput>c:\source\CloudbaseInitSetup_Beta_x64.msi</userinput> </screen></para> <para>During the installation process you should set the user that Cloudbase-Init will manage from the default "Admin" to "Administrator", unless you have (or plan to) create a special user for cloud-init purposes.</para> <para>On the last dialog of the Cloudbase-Init installation you should select the option to run Sysprep and "generify" the virtual machine image. Don't select the option to shutdown the virtual machine, as we still have one thing left to do.</para> <para>After the Sysprep has finished running, to ensure that any scripts the user runs on boot through the OpenStack nova --user-data flag (referred to as "Post-Creation" in the OpenStack dashboard) we will need to set the PowerShell execution policy to be unrestricted:<screen><userinput>powershell</userinput><userinput>Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted</userinput></screen></para> <para>During testing we noticed that unfortunately line-breaks don't translate correctly when using the "Post-Creation" textbox in the "Launch Instance" dialog in OpenStack dashboard and ConfigDrive (works fine with metadata servers) so that a Post-Creation entry of: <screen><userinput>#ps1_sysnative</userinput><userinput>net user Administrator test123! </userinput></screen> will appear in the user_data file as <screen><userinput>#ps1_sysnativenet user Administrator test123!</userinput></screen> so we recommend booting instances from the commandline python-novaclient with the --user-data=userdata.txt flag set when running "nova boot", where userdata.txt is a file written with an editor like Vi that supports writing files in DOS format (:set ff=dos).</para> <para>Once this is completed you can shut down the virtual machine immediately with:<screen> <userinput>shutdown -s -t 0</userinput></screen></para> <para>Now your image is ready to upload to the closest glance server for a test run (exciting!): <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>glance image-create --name WS2012 --disk-format raw --container-format bare --is-public --progress --property "os_type=windows" --file /tmp/ws2012.qcow2</userinput></screen> </para> <para>Some extra notes/information on installing Windows images</para>
deleted_lines: <para>We do not yet have a fully documented example of how to create a Microsoft Windows image. You can use libvirt to install Windows from an installation DVD using the same approach as with the CentOS and Ubuntu examples. Once the initial install is done, you will need to perform some Windows-specific customizations.</para>

commit_message:
Fix setup.cfg so setup could succeed

Setup.cfg refers to one of the cisco config files which are missing
in the repository. Remove missing file from setup.cfg

Change-Id: I7e2b582437ba708c2e983bf9fb3d89c80dbafb78
Closes-Bug: #1364048

subject: Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - DB
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-02 04:16:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/d56ab8b06cec31d188abdb5bf6c9f31963d829b2', 'message': "Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog

Implements: blueprint metadata-schema-catalog

A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.
This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

WORK IN PROGRESS

Currently committed:
 - DB migrate repo version script for metadef tables
 - DB CRUD: namespaces, objects, tags, properties, resource_types.
 - DB functional tests: namespaces(CRUD)
 - In progress: namespaces query pagination

Change-Id: I01cc63df3d3abe383c94cfb54598868b4bb729bb

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-08-03 00:05:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/07e24c09dde369a3fdd73118bef1b7b5a6aa1d64', 'message': "Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - DB

Implements: blueprint metadata-schema-catalog

A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.
This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

WORK IN PROGRESS

Currently committed:
 - DB migrate repo version script for metadef tables
 - DB CRUD: namespaces, objects, tags, properties, resource_types.
 - DB functional tests: namespaces(CRUD)
 - In progress: namespaces query pagination

Change-Id: I01cc63df3d3abe383c94cfb54598868b4bb729bb
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Lakshmi N Sampath <lakshmi.sampath@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wayne Okuma <wayne.okuma@hp.com>

"}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2014-08-06 05:45:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/0aef0c3177cb38b6921a333f11e65c5571862540', 'message': "Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - DB

Implements: blueprint metadata-schema-catalog

A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.
This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

Change-Id: I01cc63df3d3abe383c94cfb54598868b4bb729bb
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Lakshmi N Sampath <lakshmi.sampath@hp.com>

pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.

This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

Change-Id: I01cc63df3d3abe383c94cfb54598868b4bb729bb
DocImpact

commit_message:
Glance Metadata Definitions Catalog - DB

Implements: blueprint metadata-schema-catalog

A common API hosted by the Glance service for vendors, admins,
services, and users to meaningfully define available key / value
pair and tag metadata. The intent is to enable better metadata
collaboration across artifacts, services, and projects for
OpenStack users.

This is about the definition of the available metadata that can
be used on different types of resources (images, artifacts,
volumes, flavors, aggregates, etc). A definition includes the
properties type, its key, it's description, and it's constraints.
This catalogue will not store the values for specific instance
properties.

Change-Id: I01cc63df3d3abe383c94cfb54598868b4bb729bb
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Lakshmi N Sampath <lakshmi.sampath@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wayne Okuma <wayne.okuma@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michal Jastrzebski <michal.jastrzebski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>

subject: Avoid deadlock when logging network_info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-01 16:09:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/28b01d991238b61be2af2a1e8e9b6395c091562a', 'message': 'Aoid deadlock when logging network_info

_plug_vifs() and _unplug_vifs() in driver.py both log network_info

However network_info is not a simple structure, its a reference to
a wrapper class that wraps a green thread for async network
allocation. Accessing network_info forces a wait on the wrapped
thread (if the network allocation has not completed), which can lead
to a deadlock as follows:

Thread 1 (periodic task in Nova) has grabbed the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
in update_available_resource, and is waiting for the IO thread lock in the
logging handle routine

Thread 2 (in the ironic driver) has grabbed the IO thread lock in the logging
handle routine and is waiting for the async network object to be ready so
_str_ can be called to finish formatting the log message

Thread 3 (which is doing the async network object allocation) wants to call
update_usage in the resource tracker, but that needs the
COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE which is held by the first thread

The problem is similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71409
and the fix is simply to covert network info to a string before the call
to LOG()

Change-Id: I3b750ac386588d9235ff10a972b3ab1d8f45cf38

Thread 2 (in the ironic driver) has grabbed the IO thread lock in the logging

Thread 3 (which is doing the async network object allocation) wants to call
update_usage in the resource tracker, but that needs the
COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE which is held by the first thread

The problem is similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71409
and the fix is simply to covert network info to a string before the call
to LOG()

Closes-Bug: 1364059
Co-authored-by: Michey Mehta michey.mehta@hp.com

Change-Id: I3b750ac386588d9235ff10a972b3ab1d8f45cf38

commit_message:
Avoid deadlock when logging network_info

_plug_vifs() and _unplug_vifs() in driver.py both log network_info

However network_info is not a simple structure, its a reference to
a wrapper class that wraps a green thread for async network
allocation. Accessing network_info forces a wait on the wrapped
thread (if the network allocation has not completed), which can lead
to a deadlock as follows:

Thread 1 (periodic task in Nova) has grabbed the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE
in update_available_resource, and is waiting for the IO thread lock in the
logging handle routine

Thread 2 (in the ironic driver) has grabbed the IO thread lock in the logging
handle routine and is waiting for the async network object to be ready so
_str_ can be called to finish formatting the log message

Thread 3 (which is doing the async network object allocation) wants to call
update_usage in the resource tracker, but that needs the
COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE which is held by the first thread

The problem is similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/71409
and the fix is simply to covert network info to a string before the call
to LOG()

Closes-Bug: 1364059
Co-authored-by: Michey Mehta michey.mehta@hp.com

Change-Id: I3b750ac386588d9235ff10a972b3ab1d8f45cf38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/89/118189/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(PhilDay): Accessing network_info will block if the thread # it wraps hasn't finished, so do this this ahead of time so that # don't block while holding the logging lock. network_info_str = str(network_info) 'network_info': network_info_str}) # NOTE(PhilDay): Accessing network_info will block if the thread # it wraps hasn't finished, so do this this ahead of time so that # don't block while holding the logging lock. network_info_str = str(network_info) 'network_info': network_info_str})

commit_message:
Add Font Awesome icons

This patch adds an xstatic-packaged font awesome icon font to Horizon.
We need it, because the font icons included in Bootstrap 3 are non-free
and are likely to be excluded from some distributions. It also has a much
richer set of icons to choose from.

Change-Id: I725e0d77d230c16c01971f9af0dc02eb5662154d
Partial-implements: blueprint bp/font-icons

commit_message:
Change v3 availability-zone API to v2.1

This patch changes v3 availability-zone API to v2.1 and makes v2
unit tests share between v2 and v2.1.

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ifbd152e431d182a5ccabac7fcc84fcc8a2fc6e5a

Updating API unit and functional tests to new hacking standards

Global requirements has updating the version of hacking to a minimum of
0.9.2 and it has brought a whole slew of changes.

Change-Id: Ic294fbf95b01ca8186a4035b1365ce660bc4cee8

subject: Bypass vCenter when uploading to datastores
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-15 19:13:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/a51aa67899b40d30ba8f016a8334f2e3a65eb823', 'message': 'Bypass vCenter when uploading to datastores

The current implementation requires all the bits to go through
vCenter when uploading an image to the datastore: this is highly
inefficient, since it adds load to vCenter and makes the transfer
much slower.

This patch gives an alternative which consists in bypassing vCenter
by acquiring a ticket to directly http PUT to the ESX host.
If somehow it is not possible to get the ticket (for example if
vCenter version is less than 5.5), we fallback to the previous
implementation.

This code is used by Glance and Nova.

Change-Id: I3cab23736ee5da99917a6a9b80ad5bc3754b5216
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-19 19:01:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware/commit/c586fef612baf5dc88cbc7273b1657f90576722e', 'message': 'Bypass vCenter when uploading to datastores

The current implementation requires all the bits to go through
vCenter when uploading an image to the datastore: this is highly
inefficient, since it adds load to vCenter and makes the transfer
much slower.

This patch gives an alternative which consists in bypassing vCenter
by acquiring a ticket to directly http PUT to the ESX host.
If somehow it is not possible to get the ticket (for example if
vCenter version is less than 5.5), we fallback to the previous
implementation.

This code is used by Glance and Nova.

commit_message:
Bypass vCenter when uploading to datastores

The current implementation requires all the bits to go through
vCenter when uploading an image to the datastore: this is highly
inefficient, since it adds load to vCenter and makes the transfer
much slower.

This patch gives an alternative which consists in bypassing vCenter
by acquiring a ticket to directly http PUT to the ESX host.
If somehow it is not possible to get the ticket (for example if
vCenter version is less than 5.5), we fallback to the previous
implementation.

This code is used by Glance and Nova.

Change-Id: I3cab23736ee5da99917a6a9b80ad5bc3754b5216

added_lines: from oslo.vmware import constants @mock.patch.object(datastore.Datastore, 'get_connected_hosts') def test_get_xfer_ticket(self, fake_get_connected_hosts): fake_get_connected_hosts.return_value = ['a', 'b', 'c'] ds_name = 'ds_name' host_name = '10.0.0.2' file_path = 'openstack_glance/image_id' ticket = mock.Mock() ticket.id = 'fake_ticket' expected_ticket = 'vmware_cgi_ticket="%s"' % ticket.id ds = datastore.Datastore('fake_ref', ds_name) session = mock.Mock() def invoke_api_side_effect(*args, **kwargs): if 'get_object_property' in args: return host_name if 'AcquireGenericServiceTicket' in args: return ticket session.invoke_api.side_effect = invoke_api_side_effect url, ticket = ds.get_xfer_ticket(session, 'PUT', 'openstack_glance/image_id') expected_url = 'https://%s/folder/%s?dsName=%s&dcPath=%s' % ( host_name, file_path, ds_name, constants.ESX_DATACENTER_PATH) self.assertEqual(expected_url, url) self.assertEqual(expected_ticket, ticket)

commit_message:
Zaqar configuration reference docs

This change adds the basic configuration reference
in the user guide.

It includes the document structure outline according
the OpenStack configuration reference standard and
a list of configuration options present in zaqar.conf
with a description of default values and value types.

Configuration option tables has been generated using
the autogenerate_config_docs tool in openstack-doc-tools
repo. Needed files to easier update this tables in the
near future are located in the autogen folder.

blueprint document-config-options

Change-Id: I17884400f711f6d2723b0774c20e7df4ffb0e812

added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <book xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0" xml:id="os-zaqar-apiRef"> <title>Message Queuing API v1 Reference</title> <titleabbrev>Message Queuing API Reference</titleabbrev> <info> <!-- <copyright> <year>2013</year> <year>2014</year> <holder>OpenStack Foundation</holder> </copyright> --> <releaseinfo>API v1</releaseinfo> <productname>Message Queuing</productname> <pubdate>2014-02-20</pubdate> <!--Note that the <productname> text matches the first few words of the title. The build system splits the title into productname + rest of title on the pdf cover.--> <!--If you leave the <pubdate> element empty, the build system inserts today's date automatically. --> <legalnotice role="apache2"> <annotation> <remark>Copyright details are filled in by the build system. </remark> </annotation> </legalnotice> <abstract> <para>This document is intended for software developers interested in developing applications using the Message Queuing Application Programming Interface (<abbrev>API</abbrev>). </para> </abstract> <revhistory> <revision> <date>2014-08-10</date> <revdescription> <para>Initial document for OpenStack incubation.</para> </revdescription> </revision> </revhistory> </info> <chapter xml:id="overview"> <title>Overview of zaqar.conf</title> <para>The <filename>zaqar.conf</filename> configuration file is an <link xlink:href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INI_file">INI file format</link> as explained in <link xlink:href="http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/config_format.html">"Configuration file format"</link> section in the <link xlink:href="http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference">OpenStack Configuration Reference</link>. </para> <important> <para>Do not specify quotes around Zaqar options.</para> </important> <section xml:id="config-sections"> <title>Sections</title> <para>Configuration options are grouped by section. The Message Queueing configuration file supports the following sections: <variablelist> <varlistentry> <term> <literal>[DEFAULT]</literal> </term> <listitem> <para>Contains most configuration options. If the documentation for a configuration option does not specify its section, assume that it appears in this section. </para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <literal>[drivers]</literal> </term> <listitem> <para>Transport and storage drivers selection.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <literal>[drivers:storage:mongodb]</literal> </term> <listitem> <para>Configures the MongoDB driver.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <literal>[drivers:storage:sqlalchemy]</literal> </term> <listitem> <para>Configures the SQLAlchemy driver.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <literal>[drivers:storage:redis]</literal> </term> <listitem> <para>Configures the Redis driver.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <literal>[keystone_authtoken]</literal> </term> <listitem> <para>Configures Keystone Identity Service endpoint.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <literal>[pooling:catalog]</literal> </term> <listitem> <para>Configures pooling.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> </variablelist> </para> </section> <section xml:id="config-default"> <title>Default options</title> <para>In this section you can configure the Zaqar authentication and authorization mechanism options, enable pooling, enable locks and choose your logging preferences. </para> <section xml:id="config-default-server-options"> <title>Server configuration</title> <variablelist> <varlistentry> <term> <option>auth_strategy</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Backend to use for authentication. For no auth, keep it empty. Values include <literal>keystone</literal>. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>None</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>pooling</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Enable pooling across multiple storage backends. If pooling is enabled, the storage driver configuration is used to determine where the catalogue/control plane data is kept. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>False</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Boolean</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>admin_mode</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Activate endpoints to manage pool registry. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>False</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Boolean</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>disable_process_locking</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Whether to disable inter-process locks. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>False</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Boolean</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>lock_path</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Directory to use for lock files. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>None</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> </variablelist> </section> <section xml:id="config-default-logging-options"> <title>Logging configuration</title> <para>You can use zaqar.conf file to configure where Message Queueing logs events, the level of logging, and log formats.</para> <para>To customize log formats for OpenStack Message Queueing, use the configuration option settings documented in [table reference]</para> </section> </section> <section xml:id="config-drivers"> <title>Drivers options</title> <variablelist> <varlistentry> <term> <option>transport</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Transport driver to use. Values include <literal>wsgi</literal>. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>wsgi</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>storage</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Storage driver to use. Values include <literal>mongodb</literal>, <literal>sqlalchemy</literal>. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>sqlalchemy</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> </variablelist> </section> <section xml:id="config-storage-mongodb"> <title>MongoDB options</title> <variablelist> <varlistentry> <term> <option>uri</option> </term> <listitem> <para>MongoDB Connection URI. If SSL connection enabled, then the following <literal>ssl_keyfile</literal>, <literal>ssl_certfile</literal>, <literal>ssl_cert_reqs</literal>, <literal>ssl_ca_certs</literal> need to be set accordingly. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>None</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>ssl_keyfile</option> </term> <listitem> <para>The private keyfile used to identify the local connection against mongod. If included with the <literal>certfile</literal> then only the <literal>ssl_certfile</literal> is needed. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>None</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>ssl_certfile</option> </term> <listitem> <para>The certificate file used to identify the local connection against mongod. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>None</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>ssl_cert_reqs</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Specifies whether a certificate is required from the other side of the connection, and whether it will be validated if provided. Values include <literal>CERT_NONE</literal> (certificates ignored), <literal>CERT_OPTIONAL</literal>(not required, but validated if provided) or <literal>CERT_REQUIRED</literal>(required and validated). If the value of this parameter is not <literal>CERT_NONE</literal>, then the <literal>ssl_ca_certs</literal> parameter must point to a file of CA certificates. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>CERT_REQUIRED</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>ssl_ca_certs</option> </term> <listitem> <para>The ca_certs file contains a set of concatenated certification authority certificates, which are used to validate certificates passed from the other end of the connection. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>None</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>database</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Database name.</para> <para>Default value: <literal>zaqar</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>String</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>partitions</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Number of databases across which to partition message data, in order to reduce writer lock %. <emphasis role="strong">DO NOT</emphasis> change this setting after initial deployment. <emphasis role="strong">It MUST remain static.</emphasis> Also, you should not need a large number of partitions to improve performance, especially if deploying MongoDB on SSD storage. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>2</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Integer</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>max_attempts</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Maximum number of times to retry a failed operation. Currently only used for retrying a message post. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>1000</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Integer</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>max_retry_sleep</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Maximum sleep interval between retries. Actual sleep time increases linearly according to number of attempts performed. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>0.1</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Floating point</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>max_retry_jitter</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Maximum jitter interval to be added to the sleep interval in order to decrease probability that parallel requests will retry at the same instant. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>0.005</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Floating point</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>max_reconnect_attempts</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Maximum number of times to retry an operation that failed due to a primary node failure. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>10</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Integer</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term> <option>reconnect_sleep</option> </term> <listitem> <para>Base sleep interval between attempts to reconnect after a primary node failover. The actual sleep time increases exponentially (power of 2) each time the operation is retried. </para> <para>Default value: <literal>0.02</literal>.</para> <para>Value type: <literal>Floating point</literal>.</para> </listitem> </varlistentry> </variablelist> </section> <section xml:id="config-storage-sqlalchemy"> <title>SQLAlchemy options</title> <para></para> </section> <section xml:id="config-storage-redis"> <title>Redis options</title> <para></para> </section> <section xml:id="config-keystoneauth"> <title>Keystone Authentication options</title> <para></para> </section> <section xml:id="config-pooling"> <title>Pooling options</title> <para></para> </section> </chapter> <chapter xml:id="examples"> <title>Zaqar configuration examples</title> <para></para> </chapter> </book>

commit_message:
Fix missing trailing commas for modal dialogs

Trailing commas were accidentally removed from the 'classes' attribute
of the table actions for the Create Property and the Create Volume Type
Extra Spec dialogs. This caused the dialogs to lose their modality.

This submit fixes the problem on the two dialogs. Also there're fixes
to correct the Cancel button on the Create Property and Edit Property
dialogs which were missing the border.

Change-Id: If851732656d883fe2e26f4d4011337dac356cd25
Closes-Bug: #1362704
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/63/118463/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: classes = ("ajax-modal",)

commit_message:
API for metadata retrieval

Add API information about retrieving metadata, which is required
when Keystone is acting as a SAML2 Identity Provider.

Change-Id: I062ed20b2fa28931db43f373cd861a9be104e50c
Implements: bp keystone-to-keystone-federation

The response will be a full document with Metadata properties, note that for readability, the certificate has been truncated. commit_message:
Faster nova fixed key generation

Using bc 64 times in loop is too verbose and slow,
replacing the echo/bc loop with hexdump and urandom.

The hexdump approach is 75 times faster and
does not floods the debug logs.

Using the common function for generating,
this kind of string with lib/heat and by the read_password.

Change-Id: If6a86dfaf0c21e2635c6de0a7b96a8ed7ec5b507
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/98/96098/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $NOVA_CONF keymgr fixed_key `hexdump -n 32 -v -e '/1 "%02x"' /dev/urandom`
deleted_lines: FIXED_KEY="" for i in $(seq 1 64); do FIXED_KEY+=$(echo "obase=16; $(($RANDOM % 16))" | bc); done; iniset $NOVA_CONF keymgr fixed_key "$FIXED_KEY"

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/74/118474/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================= PXE Boot Instance ================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pxe-boot-instance This specification proposes a way to grant a compute instance the chance to boot from network. Problem description =================== Currently, compute instances must be booted from images (or snapshots) stored in Glance or volumes stored in Cinder. In enterprise environments it is often desired to be able to use a Preboot Execution Environment (PXE) to boot and install custom operating systems on virtual machines. For this reason the aim of this specification is to give the End Users the chance to select "network" as a possible booting source. It has to be underlined that the aim of this document is not to define a PXE service within OpenStack: the PXE boot service should managed externally via another machine within a tenant/provider network. Selecting the "network" as boot device a compute instance will be created and it will broadcast a DHCP request from which the PXE boot sequence will start, if a PXE Server is configured to manage that request. Once PXE/Network booting is selected by the user as the instance boot source, this will always be the default boot option for the instance's entire lifecycle. i.e. it won't just PXE boot one-time and then revert back to default. Proposed change =============== Libvirt grants yet a way to trigger the boot from network of a virtual machine, specifing the Libvirt XML attribute <boot dev='network'/> where required. We propose to take advantage of this libvirt feature within OpenStack. A new option "--netboot" will be introduced in python-novaclient module to specify the compute instance will boot from network and not from an image or volume. Python-novaclient will associate to this option a fixed special image token id, in this way no changes to REST API will be necessary. Nova module will recognize the special image token id, will bypass any check on its existence and it will use the Libvirt Driver to generate an appropriate Libvirt XML domain to boot the compute instance from network. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- [[Aside from the API, are there other ways a user will interact with this feature? * Does this change have an impact on python-novaclient? What does the user interface there look like?]] Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: matarazzoangelo Other contributors: Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== User guide is affected by these changes: --A new section "Lauch an instance from network" should be added --The Section nova commands should be changed References ========== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-empty-vm-boot-pxe https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova/Blueprints/pxe-boot-instance

spec public private networks with group membership

implements blueprint public-private-networks-with-group-membership

Change-Id: I5dde79718419facf2dfd5d70be1fcd1b2d5e7af1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress-specs refs/changes/74/116974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================= Public-Private Networks with Group Membership ============================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/congress/+spec/public-private-networks-with-group-membership Problem description =================== There are a plethora of restrictions that cloud operators may want to place on how VMs are connected to networks. For example, suppose we want to ensure that every network a VM is connected to is either a public network or the owner of the network and the other of the VM belong to the same ActiveDirectory/Keystone/etc. group. Proposed change =============== Alternatives ------------ Policy ------ error(vm) :- nova:instance(vm), nova:network(vm, network), not neutron:public(network), nova:owner(vm, vmowner), neutron:owner(network, netowner), not same_group(vmowner, netowner) same_group(x,y) :- group(x,g), group(y,g) group(x,g) :- keystone:group(x, g) group(x,g) :- ad:group(x,g) Policy Actions -------------- * Monitoring (Could also illustrate proactive/reactive actions). Data model impact ----------------- * Neutron: the list of public networks and the owner of each network * Nova: the list of networks connected to VMs and the owners of those VMs ActiveDirectory/Keystone: which users are members of which groups REST API impact --------------- Security impact --------------- Notifications impact -------------------- Other end user impact --------------------- Performance Impact ------------------ Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== References ==========

Make turning debug on globally easy.

We can obviously use passthrough for this, but I rather suspect that
OMFG something is broken get me debug will be a common phrase.

commit_message:
Make X-Project-ID a required header

We decided to make X-Project-ID a required header for every request. If
not present, a 400 error should be raised.

Partially-Implements: blueprint api-v1.1-header-changes
Change-Id: I6c6c21585e9a738ff7c0f74ce6a284229ebec2aa

commit_message:
Updated Module File Dependencies

Previously, the Modulefile did not include Keystone.
This would cause the module to not install all necessary
dependencies for Heat services.  This patch allows Heat to have
consistent dependencies with other OpenStack services.

commit_message:
Let update_available_resource hit slave

Deployments that have a slave_connection configured can offload
read queries generated by this periodic task there. For
deployments with no slave, behavior remains the same.

Change-Id: Ie663ccc4e3e4334af4bdf75a95689c41ecc959b9
Blueprint: juno-slaveification

commit_message:
Don't create _member_ role from puppet

The _member_ role is provided by db migration or is created
automatically when user is created. Creating role _member_ from
puppet causes it to have different id than the one specified in
member_role_id keystone config option.

Change-Id: I3f0102b184a484f5e5a85cadf26ed651829fbf8c
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1129760

commit_message:
Extend/fix support for extlinux bootloader

Some extlinux packages install mbr.bin under /usr/lib/extlinux or
/usr/lib/EXTLINUX so tese directories need to be checked as well.
Also, there are packages that create a /boot/extlinux directory
which needs to be taken into account. Finally, commit
bccffc8bfdfea4c452a5558a27f4d16da9cab6c7 dropped the /boot prefix
from the kernel and initrd references in the ext/syslinux config
file which is simply a bug that needs fixing.

Change-Id: Idb071c9b18ff557b0f0f76d0d754536f2deca904
Closes-Bug: 1335042

added_lines: # Find and install mbr.bin for MBR in /usr/share/syslinux/mbr.bin /usr/lib/syslinux/mbr.bin \ /usr/lib/extlinux/mbr.bin ; do if [ -f $MBR ]; then break done if [ ! -f $MBR ]; then echo "mbr.bin (from EXT/SYSLINUX) not found." exit 1 # Find any pre-created extlinux install directory for EXTDIR in /boot/extlinux /boot/syslinux ; do if [ -d $EXTDIR ] ; then break fi done if [ ! -d $EXTDIR ] ; then # No install directory found so default to /boot/syslinux EXTDIR=/boot/syslinux mkdir -p $EXTDIR fi # Finally install extlinux extlinux --install $EXTDIR
deleted_lines: MBR=/usr/share/syslinux/mbr.bin if [ ! -f $MBR ]; then MBR=/usr/lib/syslinux/mbr.bin if [ ! -f $MBR ]; then echo "mbr.bin (from SYSLINUX) not found." exit 1 mkdir -p /boot/syslinux extlinux --install /boot/syslinux

commit_message:
Run cinder-volume in active/passive mode for NFS backend

Running multiple cinder-volume instances which access the same storage
is currently not supported and may cause data inconsistency.
This issue is discussed here:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1322190

Running cinder-volume service in active/passive mode seems to be
the only safe way when shared backend storage is used. Also
workaround with setting shared host is needed.

Of course in default no-HA setup each cinder-volume manages its
local volumes and none of the above is needed.

Change-Id: Id8f5c33f63538a9be85a1434f36b0a840e0b8db9

commit_message:
Add SAML generation route to OS-FEDERATION

Create the specification for SAML generation in the OS-FEDERATION
api spec.

Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>

Implements: bp keystone-to-keystone-federation

Change-Id: Ic0e062fb593e8251efb956dd6510c6eca71e59b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/98/113998/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Generating Assertions --------------------- ### Generate a SAML assertion: `POST /OS-FEDERATION/saml2/auth` A user may generate a SAML assertion document based on the scoped token that is used in the request. Request Parameters: To generate a SAML assertion, the user provide a scoped token in the request, as well as a ``region_id``. Example request: { "saml": { "region": { "id": "--region-id"" }, "token": { "id": "--token-id--" } } } The response will be a full SAML assertion, for more information about how a SAML assertion is structured, refer to the [specification] (http://saml.xml.org/saml-specifications)

commit_message:
Implement GroupSet updatable for AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface

Implement the 'GroupSet' updatable for
AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface resource to be compatible
with AWSCloudFormation.

Change-Id: Ia92c6d2732fdafc659d1a9a1db01cb66be9a9bc0
Closes-Bug: #1334212
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/09/109809/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_allowed=True # if without group_set, don't set the 'security_groups' property, # neutron will create the port with the 'default' securityGroup, # if has the group_set and the value is [], which means to create the # port without securityGroup(same as the behavior of neutron) if self.properties[self.GROUP_SET] is not None: if self.resource_id is None: return def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): if prop_diff: update_props = {} if self.GROUP_SET in prop_diff: group_set = prop_diff.get(self.GROUP_SET) # update should keep the same behavior as creation, # if without the GroupSet in update template, we should # update the security_groups property to referent # the 'default' security group if group_set is not None: sgs = neutron.NeutronResource.get_secgroup_uuids( group_set, self.neutron(), self.context) else: sgs = neutron.NeutronResource.get_secgroup_uuids( ['default',], self.neutron(), self.context) update_props['security_groups'] = sgs self.neutron().update_port(self.resource_id, {'port': update_props})

commit_message:
Match tenant_id when name ambiguity in get_secgroup_uuids()

Neutron allows securityGroup creation with same name
between one/more users, and the admin roles can get/use
the other users' securityGroup. So if there are several
securityGroups return, we should match the one which is
belongs to the stack owner, and then to raise
'PhysicalResourceNameAmbiguity' exception if can't match.

Change-Id: Icb7eae35ba40a142a4d398b7c9d58c8483b9588e
Closes-Bug: #1348064

added_lines: def test_get_secgroup_uuids(self): # test get_secgroup_uuids with uuid security_groups = ['b62c3079-6946-44f5-a67b-6b9091884d4f', '9887157c-d092-40f5-b547-6361915fce7d'] self.assertEqual(security_groups, qr.get_secgroup_uuids(security_groups, None, None)) # test get_secgroup_uuids with name secgroups = ['security_group_1'] expected_groups = ['0389f747-7785-4757-b7bb-2ab07e4b09c3'] ctx = utils.dummy_context( tenant_id='dc4b074874244f7693dd65583733a758') fake_groups_list = { 'security_groups': [ { 'tenant_id': 'dc4b074874244f7693dd65583733a758', 'id': '0389f747-7785-4757-b7bb-2ab07e4b09c3', 'name': 'security_group_1', 'security_group_rules': [], 'description': 'no protocol' } ] } nclient = neutronclient.Client() self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'list_security_groups') neutronclient.Client.list_security_groups().AndReturn(fake_groups_list) self.m.ReplayAll() self.assertEqual(expected_groups, qr.get_secgroup_uuids(secgroups, nclient, ctx)) self.m.VerifyAll() self.m.UnsetStubs() # test there are two securityGroups with same name, but there is # one belongs to the tenant fake_groups_list = { 'security_groups': [ { 'tenant_id': 'dc4b074874244f7693dd65583733a758', 'id': '0389f747-7785-4757-b7bb-2ab07e4b09c3', 'name': 'security_group_1', 'security_group_rules': [], 'description': 'no protocol' }, { 'tenant_id': '64395a8e5beb4930a18245f76a5b1570', 'id': '384ccd91-447c-4d83-832c-06974a7d3d05', 'name': 'security_group_1', 'security_group_rules': [], 'description': 'no protocol' } ] } self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'list_security_groups') neutronclient.Client.list_security_groups().AndReturn(fake_groups_list) self.m.ReplayAll() self.assertEqual(expected_groups, qr.get_secgroup_uuids(secgroups, nclient, ctx)) self.m.VerifyAll() self.m.UnsetStubs() # test there are two securityGroups with same name, and the two # all belong to the tenant fake_groups_list = { 'security_groups': [ { 'tenant_id': 'dc4b074874244f7693dd65583733a758', 'id': '0389f747-7785-4757-b7bb-2ab07e4b09c3', 'name': 'security_group_1', 'security_group_rules': [], 'description': 'no protocol' }, { 'tenant_id': 'dc4b074874244f7693dd65583733a758', 'id': '384ccd91-447c-4d83-832c-06974a7d3d05', 'name': 'security_group_1', 'security_group_rules': [], 'description': 'no protocol' } ] } self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'list_security_groups') neutronclient.Client.list_security_groups().AndReturn(fake_groups_list) self.m.ReplayAll() self.assertRaises(exception.PhysicalResourceNameAmbiguity, qr.get_secgroup_uuids, secgroups, nclient, ctx) self.m.VerifyAll() self.m.UnsetStubs()

Instead of normal user. Or permission denied error will be found.

commit_message:
Fix rhel image can not boot issue

syslinux can not find kernel to boot if we just speicify kernel's base.

Change-Id: I6ee1d37e91e53163b11845ea4c75659f009a2f3c
Closes-Bug: #1353800

commit_message:
Making a few modules hacking 0.9.2 compliant

Global requirements has updating the version of hacking to a minimum of
0.9.2 and it has brought a whole slew of changes. This is tackling five
modules which contain new violations.

Change-Id: Iee1dc1006eaefd0fff99bb1a4924a37c4332c044

commit_message:
Change | to > in templates.

Clint pointed out that | prevents things rendering properly on
arbitrarily wide screens. For most things that makes sense but it
doesn't for the JSON examples IMO so I didn't alter those.

Change-Id: Ifb7dcc265c225b000bd5d26500212d41ea0233c8

subject: Add support for cert based access type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-16 07:00:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/95da84c843813f1baf8891d63f407e2fd78063c8', 'message': 'WIP: Add support for cert-based access type

NOTE: This is a WIP patch, posted to get early feedback/comments.

Per the Manila IRC discussions, the cert based trust setup between
instances and backend is out-of-band to Manila. See the log @
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/manila/2014/manila.2014-07-24-15.01.log.html
(15:27:19 onwards)

This patch does 2 things:
* Add support for cert access-type in access-allow API
* Add glusterfs native driver that uses cert based access type

TODOs:
* Add testcases
* Separate this into 2 patches (one for manila access-allow and
  other for for glusterfs backend implementation)

Partially-implements blueprint cert-based-access-type

Change-Id: Ib48430deccece66a740ce05471db70eaadf634b3

commit_message:
Add support for cert based access type

This patch adds support for cert based access type in Manila.
It introduces a new 'access_type' called 'cert' in access-allow API.
'access_to' argument passed by the user is the certificate's CN
(common name) to which access is allowed by the backend.

Per the Manila IRC discussions, the cert based trust setup between
instances and backend is out-of-band to Manila. See the log @
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/manila/2014/manila.2014-07-24-15.01.log.html
(15:27:19 onwards)

Partially-implements blueprint cert-based-access-type

Change-Id: Ib48430deccece66a740ce05471db70eaadf634b3

commit_message:
Cisco DFA ML2 Mechanism Driver

Part 1:
This commit contains changes to support ML2 mechanism driver for Cisco
DFA. For more details please see the blueprint which has more description and
link to document with requirements.

Part 2: Changes in OVS neutron agent.
(http://review.openstack.org/110065)

Part 3: DFA extension driver.
(http://review.openstack.org/111761)

Part 4: DFA config profile service plugin.
(http://review.openstack.org/111863)

Change-Id: Ib53b6705948e1ed75059b85d8809562d9bb63f65
Partially Implements: blueprint ml2-mechanism-driver-for-cisco-dfa

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Cisco Systems, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Nader Lahouti, Cisco Systems, Inc. import mock import testtools from neutron.db import api as db from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco.dfa import cfg_profile_db_v2 from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.cisco.dfa import dfa_exceptions as dexc from neutron.tests import base class TestConfigProfileBindig(base.BaseTestCase): """Test cases for cfg_profile_db_v2.""" def setUp(self): super(TestConfigProfileBindig, self).setUp() db.configure_db() self.addCleanup(db.clear_db) self.cfgp_mixin = cfg_profile_db_v2.ConfigProfile_db_mixin() self.context = mock.MagicMock() self.cfgp_id = '7880063b-56e1-4877-966f-65a5051cde1a' self.network_id = 'bd48bca6-d4e8-4efb-b1e9-cf9140fa1127' self.cfgp_name = 'defaultConfigProfileL2' self.fwd_mode = 'proxy-mode' def test_add_dfa_cfg_profile_binding(self): """Test add_dfa_cfg_profile_binding.""" # Add entry in the config profile binding table. self.cfgp_mixin.add_dfa_cfg_profile_binding(self.network_id, self.cfgp_id) cpb = self.cfgp_mixin._get_config_profile_binding(db.get_session(), self.cfgp_id) # Verify the entry. self.assertEqual(self.cfgp_id, cpb.cfg_profile_id) def test_add_and_get_config_profile(self): """Test get_config_profile.""" cfgp_id = self.cfgp_id self.context.session = db.get_session() with testtools.ExpectedException(dexc.ConfigProfileIdNotFound): self.cfgp_mixin.get_config_profile(self.context, cfgp_id) # Add config profile cfgp = {'id': self.cfgp_id, 'name': self.cfgp_name, 'forwarding_mode': self.fwd_mode} self.cfgp_mixin.create_config_profile(cfgp) self.context.session = db.get_session() cpb = self.cfgp_mixin.get_config_profile(self.context, self.cfgp_id) # Verify the entry. self.assertEqual(self.cfgp_id, cpb['id']) self.assertEqual(self.cfgp_name, cpb['name']) def test_delete_dfa_cfg_profile_binding(self): """Test delete_dfa_cfg_profile_binding.""" # Add entry to the binding table. self.cfgp_mixin.add_dfa_cfg_profile_binding(self.network_id, self.cfgp_id) # Verify entry exists. cpb = self.cfgp_mixin._get_config_profile_binding(db.get_session(), self.cfgp_id) self.assertEqual(self.network_id, cpb.network_id) # Delete the entry. self.cfgp_mixin.delete_dfa_cfg_profile_binding(self.network_id) # Verify it does not exist. res = self.cfgp_mixin.get_network_profile_binding(self.network_id) self.assertEqual(res, None)

subject: Move tests out of glance's package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-12 15:55:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/a4f5d6486267022b7e5a3b8580343ad9c4393b85', 'message': "Move tests out of glance's package

In order for Glance to adopt glance.store, it is necessary to move the
tests out of the server. This is due to a tests discovery issue where it
finds in the local working copy but loads them from the installed
glance. Unfortunately, we can't use develop installs to test
Glance+glance.store due a bug in Python/setuptools where all packages in
a namespace have to be installed using the same method (either install
or develop).

Unittests loader issue: http://bugs.python.org/issue19352

Partially-Implements blueprint: create-store-package

commit_message:
Move tests out of glance's package

In order for Glance to adopt glance.store, it is necessary to move the
tests out of the server. This is due to a tests discovery issue where it
finds in the local working copy but loads them from the installed
glance. Unfortunately, we can't use develop installs to test
Glance+glance.store due a bug in Python/setuptools where all packages in
a namespace have to be installed using the same method (either install
or develop).

Unittests loader issue: http://bugs.python.org/issue19352

Partially-Implements blueprint: create-store-package

Change-Id: I1e5de93709c3654b0c21957052df88430802ff8c

commit_message:
Make minor typo correction

from: openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-api.conf keystone_authtoken \
  auth_uri http://controller:5000

=>
openstack-config --set /etc/glance/glance-api.conf keystone_authtoken \
  auth_url http://controller:5000

Close-Bug: #1353635

Change-Id: I7c97b805695b011ce800c171d312b2a612bb4a9b

commit_message:
Add helper script for defining pacemaker resources

Pacemaker resources look similar for most of the services,
this script makes adding new resources easier.

Change-Id: I193a67f49e82fdb972aad8c8a9a51fe17c6c978c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/16/117716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: os-svc-enable -n ceilometer-agent-central pcmk-service-create -n ceilometer-agent-central
deleted_lines: # get resource class (systemd, upstart, lsb). It should be possible # to use 'service' class which is a wrapper for others but this doesn't work # as expected on Fedora - lrmd process segfaults if 'service' resource class # is used: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1117151 CLASS=$(dib-init-system) if [ "$CLASS" = "sysv" ]; then CLASS=lsb fi SERVICE=$(map-services ceilometer-agent-central) if os-is-bootstrap-host && ! cibadmin --query --xpath "//primitive[@id=\"$SERVICE\"]"; then /usr/sbin/cibadmin -o resources -C -X " <primitive class=\"$CLASS\" id=\"$SERVICE\" type=\"$SERVICE\"> <instance_attributes id=\"$SERVICE-instance_attributes\"/> <operations> <op id=\"$SERVICE-monitor-start-delay-10s\" interval=\"30s\" name=\"monitor\" start-delay=\"10s\"/> </operations> </primitive>" fi

commit_message:
Fix dib-lint failures

As part of an ongoing effort to apply more testing against
elements, this patch provides fixes for most dib-lint
failures outside of the set -o pipefail patch[1] including
set options, indention, and file permissions.  There are
still a few indention errors left after this patch, but
they should be ignored in a dib-lint patch soon to add
additional exclusions.

[1] Ib97e3a35dd0ee653f1298c9ffe6ea99cea9dfd55

Change-Id: Ibf3dfc5735752900598466b0a54342692ef77284

commit_message:
First attempt at an angularJS workflow for launching heat stacks

  - replaces django multi-step form view with angular wizard
  - allows for multiple file uploads, client side file downloads
    (for file URLs), etc
  - requires a custom heatclient from here:
      o https://github.com/jsomara/python-heatclient/tree/envfiles
    if this becomes a blocking issue, we can add that method to horizon
    temporarily. The other possibility is that it is extended to support
    nested stacks as well (a Juno goal). This patch includes this code
    inside horizon, with the intention of removing it when support becomes
    available in upstream python-heatclient
  - there are outstanding messaging improvements (error messages, etc) that
    this patch could take advantage of for better message dialogs

To test this, check out sample environment & template files here. You'll
notice that the referenced file in the environment will get added in
stage2 of the wizard. If you don't have any file references to resolve,
it will go straight to stage3.
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example2_server_with_volume_nested/server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/env_server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/server_with_volume_env.yaml

Fixes-Bug: #1322258
Partial-Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/heat-nested-stack

subject: Error trapping for ldap2py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-02 18:30:25.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/2ab15bb00f7ee21a962fbb5f692c809fa97b822b', 'message': 'Error trapping for ldap2py

Closes-Bug: #1364521

I've recently come across a condition where the ldap driver will
return values from Active Directory which cannot be utf8 encoded.

Network captures show a clean attribute and value list, whereas if
I put in a debug statement to write out the values as
returned by the driver I can see a value like this:
?"?gZK??[J????

I propose that we drop values which cannot be encoded.

Change-Id: I81622f3f6e6d78d714fad05d22a75261aefc27f5
'}]
commit_message:
Error trapping for ldap2py

Closes-Bug: #1364521

I've recently come across a condition where the ldap driver will
return values from Active Directory which cannot be utf8 encoded.

Network captures show a clean attribute and value list, whereas if
I put in a debug statement to write out the values as
returned by the driver I can see a value like this:
?"?gZK??[J????

I propose that we drop values which cannot be encoded.

Change-Id: I81622f3f6e6d78d714fad05d22a75261aefc27f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/29/118429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: return utf8_decode(val) except Exception: return

commit_message:
Add hasrestart to some services

(5.0.X backport)
Hasrestart makes Puppet use restart instead of stop
and start to manage a service and many init scripts
would work better if used like this.

Change-Id: I7cee7cc4690b13d896775124ad00ebeba7daf68e
Closes-Bug: 1364119

commit_message:
Add hasrestart to some services

Hasrestart makes Puppet use restart instead of stop
and start to manage a service and many init scripts
would work better if used like this.

Change-Id: I9e8e86a1c5bf4bcac9683542e9cfb7ca3100c9e8
Closes-Bug: 1364119

added_lines: hasstatus => true, hasrestart => true,

commit_message:
labs: fix libguestfs-tools installation

Supply an answer for the debconf prompt during libguestfs-tools
installation. The current lack of such an answer results in warnings
about "Use of uninitialized value" or a hanging script.

Change-Id: I23888737f24c5f4cd3c8e88ebba0701be85c1d87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/28/118328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo debconf-set-selections <<< 'libguestfs-tools libguestfs/update-appliance boolean false'

commit_message:
Update installation guide for syslinux 6

Fedora 21 and the next Ubuntu will have syslinux 6 in them. In syslinux
6 modules are not "stand alone" as it was in versions prior to 4, see:
http://www.syslinux.org/wiki/index.php/Library_modules

Partial-Bug: #1351010
Change-Id: Ie6bb031c10a9f8cf978e2c5dbd643b4a19cc93d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/94/118194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Make sure the tftp root directory exist and can be written to by the user the ``ironic-conductor`` is running as. For example:: sudo mkdir -p /tftpboot sudo chown -R ironic -p /tftpboot #. Install the syslinux package with the PXE boot images:: Ubuntu: apt-get install syslinux syslinux-common Fedora/RHEL: yum install syslinux syslinux-tftpboot #. Copy the PXE binary to ``/tftpboot``. The PXE binary might be found at: - If the version of syslinux used is <= 4:: Ubuntu: sudo cp /usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0 /tftpboot Fedora/RHEL: sudo cp /usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0 /tftpboot - If the version of syslinux is > 4 we also need to make sure that we copy the library modules into the ``/tftpboot`` directory [1]_ [2]_:: Ubuntu: sudo cp /usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0 /tftpboot sudo cp /usr/lib/syslinux/modules/*/ldlinux.* /tftpboot Fedora/RHEL: sudo cp /usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0 /tftpboot .. [1] http://www.syslinux.org/wiki/index.php/Library_modules .. [2] On *Fedora/RHEL* the ``syslinux-tftpboot`` package already install the library modules at ``/tftpboot``. If the TFTP server is configured to listen to a different directory you should copy the library modules from ``/tftpboot`` to the configured directory
deleted_lines: #. Make sure these directories exist:: sudo mkdir -p /tftproot sudo chown -R ironic:LIBVIRT_GROUP -p /tftproot mkdir -p /tftproot/pxelinux.cfg #. Copy the PXE binary to ``/tftproot``. The PXE binary might be found at:: ubuntu: /usr/lib/syslinux/pxelinux.0 fedora/RHEL: /usr/share/syslinux/pxelinux.0

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from openstack.network.v2 import pool_member IDENTIFIER = 'IDENTIFIER' EXAMPLE = { 'address': '1', 'admin_state_up': True, 'id': IDENTIFIER, 'tenant_id': '4', 'protocol_port': 5, 'status': '6', 'subnet_id': '7', 'weight': 8, } class TestPoolMember(testtools.TestCase): def test_basic(self): sot = pool_member.PoolMember() self.assertEqual('member', sot.resource_key) self.assertEqual('members', sot.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/v2.0/pools/%(pool_id)/members', sot.base_path) self.assertEqual('network', sot.service.service_type) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_create) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_retrieve) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_update) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_delete) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_list) def test_make_it(self): sot = pool_member.PoolMember(EXAMPLE) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['address'], sot.address) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['admin_state_up'], sot.admin_state_up) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['id'], sot.id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['tenant_id'], sot.project_id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['protocol_port'], sot.protocol_port) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['status'], sot.status) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['subnet_id'], sot.subnet_id) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['weight'], sot.weight)

commit_message:
Doc: don't generate empty properties fields

Don't create empty properties fields in the resources samples.

This patch will help resolve niceness gates failures when generating the
docbook HOT reference.

Change-Id: I3c74fa583ac55dc0a23520ec07f5d07e3d1b6fab
Closes-Bug: #1360558

commit_message:
correctly implement volumes_from property

The Docker plugin incorrectly implements the 'volumes_from' option:

- The property is marked as a string when it should be a list, and
- The property needs to be passed to start_container rather than
  create_container.

Change-Id: I617a4d29a9edbb45d80c7b8abb8f87eeaf795a8b
closes-bug: #1364041
closes-bug: #1364039

commit_message:
Temporarily pin requests<2.4.0

Today's release of requests 2.4.0 has resulted in unit test issues
for horizon and python-keystoneclient, but the problem may be more
widespread. Since we're nearing an integrated release milestone,
it's pragmatic to pin this now and allow projects to work out their
compatibility bugs after the milestone.

Change-Id: Id5180803402d207d6e59610474c11c61622f6b5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/48/117848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Remove reference to cisco_cfg_agent.ini from setup.cfg again

No sample .ini file is included, causing install to fail.
Remove the reference again.

commit_message:
Deprecate cinder_* configuration settings

Create a new section in the configuration file called 'cinder'.
Move all of the cinder_* configuration settings to this section.

DocImpact

The table below has the changes:

+---------------------------------+----------------------------+
| 'DEFAULT' Section               | 'cinder' Section           |
|---------------------------------|----------------------------|
| cinder_catalog_info             | catalog_info               |
| cinder_endpoint_template        | endpoint_template          |
| os_region_name                  | os_region_name             |
| cinder_ca_certificates_file     | ca_certificates_file       |
| cinder_http_retries             | http_retries               |
| cinder_http_timeout             | http_timeout               |
| cinder_api_insecure             | api_insecure               |
| cinder_cross_az_attach          | cross_az_attach            |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------+

UpgradeImpact
The changes are backward compatible.

Change-Id: Ie6b3f9d60b5e149375ff3039be444538f5f50756
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/00/100800/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update apt_pre-download script

Refactor apt_pre-download script to classify the packages as per the
services and nodes for better debugging. This change makes it much
more convinent to go through the apt_pre-download.sh for adding,
debugging the issues.

Change-Id: I49f16953805a5895b813abfda2a33775c54236fc

commit_message:
Squash Icehouse DB Migrations

MySQL: Produces an identical database, with one bug fixed in migration 40.
SQLite: Produces a "better" database, with some lost constraints restored.
PostgreSQL: Produces an identical database, with a bug in migration 39 fixed.

Change-Id: I8c8397ad38cc2d6344aa169c766e3adf18043ee1

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/03/118403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: As a project, Horizon adheres to code quality standards. The following standards are divided into required and recommended sections. Our main goal in establishing these best practices is to have code that is reliable, readable, and maintainable. Reliable * Use '===' as oppose to '==' for equality checks. The '==' will do a type cast before comparing, which can lead to unwanted results. * Keep document reflows to a minimum. DOM manipulation is expensive, and can become a performance issue. If you are accessing the DOM, make sure that you are doing it in the most optimized way. One example is to build up a document fragment and then append the fragment to the DOM in one pass instead of doing multiple smaller DOM updates. * Use strict, enclosing each JavaScript file inside a self-executing function. The self-executing function keeps the strict scoped to the file, so its variables and methods are not exposed to other JavaScript files in the product. .. Note :: Using strict will throw exceptions for common coding errors, like accessing global vars, that normally are not flagged. Example: (function(){ 'use strict'; // code... })(); * Use for each when looping whenever possible. AngularJS, and jQuery both provide for each loops that provide both iteration and scope. AngularJS: angular.forEach(objectToIterateOver, function(value, key) { // loop logic }); jQuery: $.each(objectToIterateOver, function( key, value ) { // loop logic }); * Do not put variables or functions in the global namespace. There are several reasons why globals are bad, one being that all JavaScript included in an application runs in the same scope. Which means that if another script has the same method or variable names they overwrite each other. * Always put ``var`` in front of your variables. Not putting ``var`` in front of a variable puts that variable into the global space, see above. * Do not use ``eval( )``. The eval (expression) evaluates the expression passed to it. This can open up your code to security vulnerabilities, and other issues. * Do not use '``with`` object {code}'. The ``with`` statement is used to access properties of an object. The issue with ``with`` is that its execution is not consistent, so by reading the statement in the code it is not always clear how it is being used. Readable & Maintainable * Give meaningful names to methods and variables * Put a comment at the top of every file explaining what the purpose of this file is. This guideline also applies to methods and variables when the naming is not obvious. * Avoid excessive nesting. * Avoid HTML and CSS in JS code. HTML and CSS belong in templates and stylesheets respectively. For example: 1. In our HTML file, we should focus on layout. i. Reduce the small/random
deleted_lines: As a project, Horizon adheres to code quality standards for our JavaScript just as we do for our Python. To that end we recommend (but do not strictly enforce) the use of JSLint_ to validate some general best practices. The default options are mostly good, but the following accommodate some allowances we make: * Set ``Indentation`` to ``2``. * Enable the ``Assume console, alert, ...`` option. * Enable the ``Assume a browser`` option. * Enable the ``Tolerate missing 'use strict' pragma`` option. * Clear the ``Maximum number of errors`` field. * Add ``horizon,$`` to the ``Predefined`` list. We don't require that everything works with JavaScript disabled. It's fine to introduce features that require that JavaScript is enabled in the user's web browser. The code has to work on the stable versions of Firefox, Chrome, Safari, and Opera web browsers, and on Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 and later.

subject: ML2: Fix release of network segments to allocation pools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-01 11:41:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_ml2_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c71f0bbf967a9d356f1276839dd04098847e35cf', 'message': "ML2: Fix release of network segments to allocation pools

The recent merge of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/115025/ broke the
release of network segments to allocation pools on network delete,
resulting in network creates eventually failing with
NoNetworkAvailable exceptions. The network_delete() code is rearranged
to properly release the network segments, and a unit test is updated
to verify that the type drivers' release_segment() method is called.

Partially implements: Blueprint ml2-type-driver-refactor

Change-Id: Ica5f11b2012dedfcc097f34f1515f5f3ca208fd2
"}]
commit_message:
ML2: Fix release of network segments to allocation pools

The recent merge of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/115025/ broke the
release of network segments to allocation pools on network delete,
resulting in network creates eventually failing with
NoNetworkAvailable exceptions. The network_delete() code is rearranged
to properly release the network segments, and a unit test is updated
to verify that the type drivers' release_segment() method is called.

Partially implements: Blueprint ml2-type-driver-refactor

Change-Id: Ica5f11b2012dedfcc097f34f1515f5f3ca208fd2

commit_message:
report missing containers as deleted

The docker plugin will fail to delete a container resource if the
specified container is missing:

    APIError: 404 Client Error: Not Found ("No such container: None")

This patch modifies check_delete_complete to return 'true' if the docker
module raises an error for a 404 response from Docker.

closes-bug: #1364017
Change-Id: I33373ea0c010a5809454a5065e13c724731a21ce

Add openstack_version_prev key to deployment info

We should send to Astute information about previous openstack versions,
since it's needed by our puppet manifests.

commit_message:
Check ERROR state from driver in _do_sync_power_state

Power driver can returns ERROR state. This error is not checked
in manager._do_sync_power_state.

Partial-Bug: #1358816

commit_message:
add ceph-extras and fast-cgi repositories.

adds ceph-extras and mod_fastcgi repositories, with newer versions for
required dependencies.

both off by default. includes rspec and rspec system tests.

Change-Id: I7aa0011b1891dfb3bcdfba8a59c409bb499593a7

commit_message:
Add boot_device support for vbox

In the Ironic ssh driver,
command set of 'set_boot_device' and 'get_boot_device' were not implemented
on VirualBox. This fixes it.

Change-Id: Icd19c7d1b5c11109cb6b400e99a6e7f2baa73d22
Closes-Bug: #1360017
